column1: Online TransactionPay Online   Link to External Website
• C.P.A. (Corporate Performance Assessment)
Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council has been measured as Excellent in the way that it serves its local people.
• Cabinet Warrants of Office
Each member of the Cabinet has a 'Warrant of Office', setting out their role and responsibilities
For a list of hotels and self catering establishments in Tameside and local campsites
For information on local canals running through Tameside including attractions, canal trips and the restoration work at Stalybridge
• Car boot sales
General information for those wishing to hold a car boot sale, and an application form.
Complaints about items bought at a car boot sale, telephone 0161 342 8355
• Car parks
Frequently asked questions, locations and prices for town centre pay and display car parks and contract car park passes
• Car Tax and Registration
Information on taxing and registering a vehicle
The council is responsible for licensing Caravan sites in the Borough
Provides more information on Care Homes (residential and nursing homes) in Tameside.
• Careers Advice
Is available for young people at the Connexions Centre, 2-4, Clarence Arcade, Stamford Street, Ashton-under-Lyne, OL6 7PT.
The Carers in Tameside pages have comprehensive information for Carers in general, with links to useful organisations for support and advice
The council cleans all streets in the borough on a rota basis and has a maintenance programme
• Cemeteries
The Council provides cemeteries at Ashton, Audenshaw, Denton, Droylsden, Dukinfield, Hyde, Mossley and Mottram and a crematorium at Dukinfield
For general information or details of forthcoming events
• Central Government A to Z
DirectGov lists all central government departments, executive agencies and non-departmental public bodies
• Centre of Excellence (North West)
The Office of the Deputy Prime Minister launched the Centres of Procurement Excellence initiative in February 2004, in order to support Councils in delivering the National Procurement Strategy.
• Change of Address
Moving home can be a stressful time - we've gathered together some information plus an on-line form to notify us of your change of address
A child taking part in a performance, which can include TV or filming, theatre, sporting activities or modeling, will require chaperoning.
• Charitable Collections
To apply for a permit to hold a house-to-house or street collection, or to view the list of collections authorised by the authority
Pulling the plug, ringing the change - the history of Chartism in Tameside
• Chemist
Links to the NHS website where you can locate your local Health Services
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Chess clubs within the Borough
• Chief rents on Council Properties and Land
Need advice or guidance about a young person aged 0-17?
• Child and Family Consultation Service

In partnership with the health authority, providing assessment and therapeutic services to children and families with emotional/behavioural difficulties. Referrals are normally through your doctor, 0161 303 8121
• Child Employment Regulations
For guidance on the type of work and hours, together with an application for child employment licence.
Children's hospices provide respite and terminal care for children suffering from life-limiting conditions.
Tameside Local Safeguarding Children Board (LSCB) works to improve the quality of child protection work
• Child Tax Credit
Find out more about Child Tax Credit and use the online calculator from HM Revenues and Customs
Need advice or guidance about a young person aged 0-17?
Responsible for the local implementation of the National Childcare Strategy
• Childline
Frequently asked questions about, and benefits for childminders. Telephone 0161 342 5434 to register as a childminder.
• Children and Young People
Links to a host of information for children and young people
• Children and Young People's Partnership
Links to the latest newsletters from the Children and Young People's Partnership
• Children with Additional Needs
Family Information Network Database in Tameside
A resource centre for children with disabilities and their families
• Children's Fund (Tameside)

Tameside Children's Fund is a web site aimed at 5 - 13 year olds who live in the area. The Fund's main focus is to involve children and young people in planning and delivering services that will provide for themselves and other children in the community.
• Children's Homes

Inspection reports for Children's Resource Centres (homes) in Tameside or contact the local office - NCSC Ashton-under-Lyne (Oldham, Stockport, Tameside) Area Office, 2nd Floor, Heritage Wharf, Portland Place, Ashton-under-Lyne, OL7 0QD. Tel: 0161 214 8120
• Children's Information Service and Childcare
Looking for childcare? For frequently asked questions about baby-sitters, childminders, crèches, nannies, nursery schools, out-of-school clubs, parent and tot groups, playgroups or preschool groups
• Children's Library Website
Includes recommending reading lists, profiles on favourite authors and homework help
Tameside is formally twinned with Bengbu in China
An information service which provides information on Care Homes in Tameside plus information on practical Home Support Services
Links to the community database holding details of Christadelphian Churches within the Borough

Links to Refuse Collections, Shopping in Ashton, Doctors/Chemists opening times, Swimming Pools/Sports Centres, Council Offices/Customer Service Centres opening times and Recycling your Christmas Waste
Links to the community database holding details of Church of England places of worship within the Borough
Links to the community database holding details of independently run cinema clubs within the borough.
• Cinemas
To find details of cinemas in Tameside
The Citizen 2000 Panel is a consultation group of randomly selected Tameside residents
The Tameside Citizen newspaper is distributed free to all Tameside households 4 times a year
• Citizens Advice Bureau
• Civic Advisory Panel
At every ordinary meeting of the Council, members of the public have the chance to have a question asked on their behalf by members of the Civic Advisory Panel about broader Council wide issues.
For locations and opening hours of local sites
• Civic Mayor of Tameside
Details about the Mayor, who for 2006/2007, is Councillor Margaret Sidebottom
From the 5th December, same sex couples will be able to legally register their partnership.
The Civil Contingencies Act 2004 places an obligation on Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council to prepare and plan for major incidents or emergencies that may occur within its borough
• Clinical Waste
Frequently Asked Questions regarding Clinical Waste
• Clinics
Links to the NHS website where you can locate your local Health Services
You may be entitled to help towards the cost of a school clothing or footwear - for further information and an application form
Now known as 'Social Enterprise Development' for people who wish to develop their own co-operative business. The service included startup funding advice and support
The coal industry in Tameside was at its height in the mid 18th century
• Code of Corporate Governance
Local Authorities prepare and adopt a local code of corporate governance
For information on council land or premises available
• Commercial Waste
We provide a full range of waste collection and disposal services to businesses
For dates and times of Committee meetings together with agendas, reports and minutes of meetings
Full details of the Council's Committee structure
• Community Alarms
Help on hand 24 hours a day at the touch of a button. The service is linked to the council's new call centre and mobile warden service
• Community and Voluntary Sector Grants and Support
Tameside Third Sector Coalition (T3SC) provides funding information.
Find out more about training in your local community and the venues in which these courses are held
• Community Buildings and Town Halls
Lists the local town halls. Some rooms have bars for hire and a first class catering service is also available
Frequently asked questions about this tax which is also known as the Poll Tax
The community database holds details of independently run clubs and organisations. Use it to search for local scouts, football clubs, churches or animal welfare organisations etc
• Community Drugs and Alcohol Team
The community database holds details of independently run clubs and organisations. Use it to search for local scouts, football clubs, churches or animal welfare organisations etc
• Community Legal Service Partnership
Need advice about housing, benefits, debt or other legal matters? The Tameside Community Legal Service Partnership website contains a directory of advice providers
• Community Occupational Therapy Team
A service available to Tameside residents who have a substantial and permanent physical disability
A Community Rehabilitation Order was previously a Probation Order and it is a Court Order, which is made to help you to avoid further offending
• Community Response Service
Help on hand 24 hours a day at the touch of a button. The service is linked to the council's new call centre and mobile warden service
Working in partnership to create a safe, crime free environment in Tameside
• Community Strategy
The Community Strategy is produced by the Tameside Strategic Partnership.

Tameside Council is committed to delivering the highest possible service to our customers - if you are dissatisfied in any way with any service provided by us please let us know. Wherever possible we will use the information to improve our services
• Composters
Garden bins for recycling household and garden waste
links to the community database holding details of independently run computer clubs within the Borough
• Computer Learning Centres
• Concessionary Bus Passes
• Conduct and Ethics - Standards 593.29 KB
This document draws together the standards of conduct and ethics expected of officers and members of Tameside MBC
Conference Centre, Portland Basin Heritage Centre, Portland Place, Ashton-under-Lyne, OL7 0QA. Provides rooms and facilities for conferences, seminars and other events.
Tameside MBC will no longer be operating a Confidential Waste Paper Collection Service.
Designated areas of special architectural or historic interest
The constitution provides the framework within which the Council conducts its business and makes decisions
To access the online consultation database, for full details of all local consultation activities and events
Based at the Council Offices, Ashton under Lyne and offers a range of advice on consumer rights and trading standards
Have you ever bought substandard goods or services?
For a list of email addresses and telephone contact numbers for the council
The Environmental Protection Unit of the Council deals with a wide range of contamination issues
• Contract Car Park Passes
Charges for 5 and 6 day car park passes
An on-line database detailing all private prosecution cases taken by Tameside MBC since 1st January 2002 which have resulted in a conviction
All premises where cooling towers and evaporative condensers are situated must register with the council.
• Copley Leisure Centre
Details of our Copyright and Disclaimers
• Corporate Asset Management Plan
Outlines the Council's approach to asset management and highlights the progress made since the publication of the last Corporate Asset Management Plan
• Corporate Performance Assessment
Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council has been measured as Excellent in the way that it serves its local people.
The 2006/09 Corporate Plan is, in accordance with Government guidelines, our annual Best Value Performance Plan
• Council Housing
Tameside Council Housing stock has been transferred to New Charter Housing Trust Group
• Council Meetings
Notice of Council meetings appear in the events calendar
The Council Offices are located on Wellington Road in Ashton-under-Lyne
• Council Tax
For details how to contact us, to make secure credit card payments, query balances or council tax bands, discounts, direct debit scheme etc.
Council Tax Benefit helps pay towards or covers your council tax bill, whether you rent or own your home, or live rent-free
Profiles of the local councillors, contact details, ward queries and timetable for forthcoming Councillor Surgeries

For details of the wide variety of countryside ready for you to explore, walks and trails, our Visitors Centres and the Country Park Rangers who organise guided walks around the Borough, activity days, conservation events and much more...
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Craft clubs within the Borough
• Credit Card Payments

On-line payments can now be made for Council Tax, Business rates, Mortgages, Car Park fines or general debts, together with payments for goods such as dustbins, archive photographs etc (see appropriate entries in the AZ).
• Credit Unions

Are non-profit making co-operative organisations which offer an easy way to save regularly and can provide low-cost loans. Members own and manage their own credit union. Tameside has an extensive network of credit unions - for information on local credit unions and help in setting one up
The creditors payments team organises payments to local suppliers and contractors who have done work for the Council within 30 days of receipt of invoice
• Crematorium
Links to the community database holding details of independently run cricket clubs within the Borough
Working in partnership to create a safe, crime free environment in Tameside
• Crimestoppers
• Culverts and Watercourses
Use the on-line form to report any problems with a watercourse, stream or culvert

For all enquiries about council services and other information. The Centres provide information on and organise interviews about benefits with welfare rights advisers. Arrangements to use our interpreter and translation service can be made through the Centres
Policies and Plans for more and safer cycling
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
